mcq.statement: Why are sun rays able to pass through the greenhouse gases layer to reach the Earth?

options.b: They are powerful shortwave length rays

mcq.one_liner: Sun rays can pass through the greenhouse gases layer because these rays are **powerful shortwave length rays** that penetrate the atmosphere effectively.
